pr_title: xds: implement xDS circuit breaking max_requests

timeline.message: Add a new API on stats object for recording uncategorized drops.
Add maxConcurrentRequests field in the EDS LB config.
Retrieve circuit breaker info from CDS responses.
Generate EDS LB config with max_concurrent_requests in CDS LB policy.
Implement and test circuit breaking max_concurrent_requests feature in the EDS lb policy.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:grpc/grpc-java into impl/xds_circuit_breaking

timeline.bodyText: If result is a buffering result, should we drop the request immediately as well?
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: result.getSubchannel() != null should be the thing to cover it.
replies.author: voidzcy

replies.bodyText: I think for buffering result (result.getStatus().isOk() && result.getSubchannel() == null), it should also be dropped immediately.
replies.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: Why? It will cause RPCs to be dropped prematurely. We shouldn't do anything to buffer result. The channel will handle it correctly.
replies.author: voidzcy

replies.bodyText: If requestCount.get() >= maxConcurrentRequest it should drop the RPC regardless of the subchannel's readiness. What's dropped prematurely?
replies.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: No, that should not count toward the number of dropped requests. Also, it doesn't make sense to override the non-ready picker with a drop picker.
replies.author: voidzcy
